fields.title: Jones Gets a Shock, Will Miss Time
fields.content:
Leopards starting pitcher Kerry Jones received medical attention yesterday after suffering minor burns at his home. Jones was apparently attempting to fix an appliance when he received an electrical shock that burned his left hand.

According to teammate Samuel Serginson, who spoke to Jones shortly after the accident, the injury will likely keep Jones out of action for the next few days, but there is no reason to believe he will suffer any long-term side effects.

fields.title: Rodmell Severely Injured by Farm Equipment
fields.content:
Bulls starting pitcher Ellis Rodmell is in critical but stable condition at a local hospital after an accident at his farm yesterday. Rodmell suffered multiple serious injuries when the tractor he was riding on reportedly fell on top of him.

According to a hospital spokesperson, Rodmell had internal bleeding when he arrived and may have suffered damage to several vital organs. Externally, Rodmell had numerous broken bones and his right arm and leg were nearly crushed.

"Ellis has been stabilized and he's out of immediate danger," said team doctor Rhys Kerswell, who has maintained contact with attending surgeons. "Still, the next 24-48 hours are going to be crucial. They need to make sure all of his organs are functioning properly."

Rodmell was airlifted from his rural farm to the hospital, which is 30 miles away. Doctors indicated that quick thinking by his wife and children likely saved Rodmell's life. 

The Bulls released a statement today that read, "Our thoughts and prayers are with Ellis and his family at this time. We are confident in the medical treatment he is receiving and optimistic that Ellis will make a full recovery.

fields.title: Rodmell Expected to Recover, but Career 'Definitely Over'
fields.content:
Ellis Rodmell has been upgraded to serious condition after sustaining multiple injuries in a farming accident two days ago. The Bulls starting pitcher is reported to have suffered a collapsed lung and a bruised kidney, in addition to a broken leg and fractured ribs.

Doctors were also able to save his right arm, which was severely damaged and nearly needed to be amputated. However, several bones in the arm were shattered and there is likely to be extensive nerve damage.

"All things considered, Ellis is extremely lucky to be alive," said team doctor Rhys Kerswell, who visited Rodmell this morning. "The sad news is that his career is definitely over. You just don't come back from injuries like these at his age to play professionally again."

While teammates expressed relief that Rodmell was doing better, many were devastated upon hearing that his playing days were finished. "It's just so unfair," lamented teammate Juan Crespi. "Ellis is such a great guy. I'm glad he's gonna be alright, but it tears me up that he'll never play again. He loves the game so much." Rodmell will likely require a prolonged stay in the hospital before he is released.

fields.title: Manchester-Dublin Deal Confirmed
fields.content:
Media sources in Manchester are reporting that a rumored trade between the Comets and the Dublin Harps has been finalized.

The deal, which is expected to be announced sometime during the next few hours, will reportedly send 27-year-old RHP Jesús Romero to Dublin in return for 24-year-old RF Neale Hadden. The clubs were noncommittal on the trade, but did not deny it.

During his career Romero has posted a 4-and-2 record with 3 saves and a 4.55 ERA.

fields.title: Dragons-Dockers Swap Confirmed
fields.content:
Newspapers in Cardiff and Liverpool reported that the Dragons have reached a deal sending 38-year-old RHP Kirk Beacan to the Dockers for 23-year-old 3B Ossnain Pavyer and 21-year-old CF Miguel Angel Pacheco.

A check of his career stats reveals Beacan has chalked up 88 wins and 69 losses with 875 strikeouts and a 4.27 ERA. Opposing teams have put up a .273 batting average against him.

fields.title: Spring Training Begins
fields.content:
There is nothing like spring training baseball. British and Irish Baseball League clubs will be faced with some difficult decisions as they prep their club for the grueling marathon ahead.

This will be the closest some players will ever come to a BIBL squad, so they will not only be enjoying the atmosphere but working doubly hard to gain some pointers for career advancement from the pros.

The first day's games see Liverpool visit Glasgow, Dublin travel to Manchester, Cardiff host Bristol and London entertain Birmingham.

fields.title: Spring Training Day 1 Results
fields.content:
The first day of Spring Training ahead of the 2018 season has brought wins for Glasgow, Manchester, Bristol and Birmingham.

In Glasgow, the Leopards edged out Liverpool 1-0 with a single run in the second inning, while the other Northern Conference game saw Manchester clinch a 3-1 success over Dublin with a vital insurance run in the eighth.

In the Southern Conference, two runs in the top half of the ninth inning took Bristol to a 4-2 victory over the Cardiff Dragons, while London could not recover from a poor fifth inning as they were beaten 5-1 at home by Birmingham.

fields.title: Spring Training Day 2 Results
fields.content:
Glasgow and Birmingham remain undefeated after the second day of Spring Training games, while Liverpool and London both earned their first victories.

Up in Scotland, the Leopards shut out Dublin 2-0 despite being out-hit eight to six, while the Rhinos recovered from a 4-0 deficit after four innings to turn the game around and beat Cardiff 6-4.

Liverpool earned a crushing 9-1 victory over the Manchester Comets, while London bounced back from a poor opening game and scored reguarly throughout their contest in Bristol, eventually finishing with a 7-1 success.

fields.title: Spring Training Day 3 Results
fields.content:
The Birmingham Rhinos are the only team still undefeated in Spring Training after they scored in both the seventh and eighth innings in Bristol to turn a 5-4 deficit into a 6-5 victory over the Bulls. Glasgow suffered a first defeat when they let slip a sixth inning advantage and fell 3-1 in Manchester.

Both Dublin and Cardiff are still looking for their first wins of the year, as the Harps were shut down completely in losing 6-0 at Liverpool. The Dragons led 2-1 in the sixth inning at London, but gave up five runs in that frame on their way to a 6-2 defeat.

fields.title: Spring Training Day 4 Results
fields.content:
Birmingham remain unbeaten in Spring Training after scoring five times in the eighth inning to earn a 5-1 victory over the London Kings today. Likewise Cardiff remain without a win, as the Dragons earned an early 2-0 lead at Bristol but gave up three in the seventh to lose 3-2.

In the Northern Conference, Glasgow have the best record as an eight-run eighth inning carried them to a crushing 13-1 win at Liverpool. The Dublin Harps are finally off the mark after scoring three in the first against Manchester and leading throughout to take the game 6-2.

fields.title: Spring Training Day 5 Results
fields.content:
All expectation today was that Birmingham would continue their unbeaten Spring Training run against winless Cardiff, but the Dragons sprung a big shock as they led throughout the game and beat the Rhinos 6-3 to get their season up and running.

Elsewhere, Liverpool came back from a 4-0 second-inning deficit to score three in the fifth and three more in the eighth, beating the Manchester Comets 6-4. The other two games were very close, Bristol winning 4-3 at London and a single fourth-inning run earning Dublin a 1-0 success at home to Glasgow.

fields.title: Rhinos LF Crummock Out
fields.content:
Injuries are something every team has to deal with. That fact struck home for the Rhinos when after today's game against the Dragons, the club found out they would be without the services of Caoimhín Crummock for at least 7 weeks.

After the game, his manager said of the incident, "You hate to lose anyone to injury. That's always a negative." Crummock was injured earlier today running the bases and suffered a torn hamstring.

fields.title: Spring Training Day 6 Results
fields.content:
At the mid-way point in Spring Training, six of the league's eight teams have recorded three wins and three defeats from their six games.

Birmingham are the only team with a winning record after a strong start carried them to a 5-2 win over the Bristol Bulls, while Cardiff have the only losing record after they fell 4-2 in twelve innings to the London Kings today.

All four Northern Conference teams are 3-3, with Dublin shutting out Liverpool 5-0 and Glasgow wasting a good start when they crashed 8-5 at home to the Manchester Comets.

fields.title: Keith Mountford out with DTD Injury
fields.content:
The Bristol Bulls received some welcome news today. They will not need to place right fielder Keith Mountford on the disabled list.

During yesterday's game against the Birmingham Rhinos, he was injured throwing the ball. The injury, however, is not serious. The Bristol star performer is listed as day-to-day with a sore elbow.

fields.title: Spring Training Day 7 Results
fields.content:
The Birmingham Rhinos went down to their second Spring Training defeat today when a ninth-inning run gave London a dramatic 4-3 victory.

Elsewhere, Cardiff overcame Bristol 6-4 in a game which saw the lead change hands three times, while Glasgow shut down Liverpool in a 3-0 victory. In the day's other game, Manchester took an early 2-0 lead over Dublin but the Harps battled back with runs in the third, fifth and sixth to take it 3-2.

fields.title: Spring Training Day 8 Results
fields.content:
It was a high scoring day in Spring Training play today, with all four games seeing double-figure run total. The most scoring of all came in Wales, where Cardiff gave up six first-inning runs against Birmingham and eventually crashed to a 12-7 defeat.

A late surge from London took them past the Bristol Bulls 8-3, while Liverpool almost let slip a 6-1 lead over Manchester but eventually held on to win it 7-5. The game between Dublin and Glasgow was tied after six innings, but the Harps finished better and three runs in the ninth helped to seal an 8-4 win.

fields.title: Spring Training Day 9 Results
fields.content:
Birmingham's superb run contined today as they destroyed Bristol 10-1, taking their Spring Training record to 7-2. As strong as the Rhinos are looking, the Cardiff Dragons are looking equally poor as they fell to an 8-2 defeat in London.

There were two dramatic games in the Northern Conference. Manchester edged out Glasgow 2-1 with the decisive run scoring in the eighth inning, while there was an even more exciting tussle in Liverpool.

Tied at 8-8 after the regulation nine innings, the game against Dublin went into the twelfth where the Harps took a 9-8 lead, only for the Dockers to hit back with two runs of their own and take it 10-9.

fields.title: Spring Training Day 10 Results
fields.content:
It was an unexpectedly poor day for the Birmingham Rhinos today as the team with the best Spring Training record were crushed 12-1 at home by the London Kings, who now share the best record with the Rhinos at 7-3.

Cardiff's struggles continued, as they managed only two hits all day and were shut out 7-0 by Bristol. Two runs in the ninth earned Manchester a 2-1 comeback victory in Dublin, while a high-scoring battle in Liverpool ended in a 15-8 win for the Dockers over the Glasgow Leopards.

fields.title: Spring Training Day 11 Results
fields.content:
Birmingham got back to winning ways today as they scored three in the first inning of their game against Cardiff, eventually beating the Dragons 5-2. London matched them with a 1-0 win over Bristol, as the two teams battle to finish Spring Training with the best record.

In the Northern Conference, Liverpool have the best record and they won again today, but the Dockers had to come back from a 2-0 deficit to beat the Manchester Comets. A four-run eighth sealed a 6-2 victory. Dublin let slip a 3-0 lead in the seventh inning against Glasgow, but recovered to score the winning run in the eighth and take it 4-3.

There is one more day of Spring Training to come, with the final pre-season games scheduled for tomorrow.

fields.title: Spring Training Day 12 Results
fields.content:
Birmingham have finished Spring Training with the best record this year as they surged to an 8-0 lead after five innings against Bristol, eventually taking it 8-2. London could have shared the honour, but let an extra-innings lead slip away as they gave up two in the tenth to lose 3-2 in Cardiff.

Dublin and Liverpool share the best record in the Northern Conference, after a four-run fourth earned the Harps a 5-3 win in their meeting today. The other game saw Manchester turn it around in the ninth to beat Glasgow 4-3.

Attention now turns to Friday night, when the 2018 regular season gets underway.

SPRING TRAINING STANDINGS:

North: Dublin 7-5, Liverpool 7-5, Manchester 6-6, Glasgow 4-8
South: Birmingham 9-3, London 8-4, Bristol 4-8, Cardiff 3-9

fields.title: Opening Day
fields.content:
British and Irish Baseball League fans have been pining for Opening Day ever since the league published its 2018 schedule several months ago. It is finally here!

Last year Liverpool overcame Birmingham in the Championship Series, and the two are well fancied to meet again for this year's title.

 

The slate for the first day of the new season includes:

Glasgow Leopards @ Manchester Comets
Dublin Harps @ Liverpool Dockers
London Kings @ Bristol Bulls
Cardiff Dragons @ Birmingham Rhinos

fields.title: MacLeish Lays Hammer Down in 4-1 Win
fields.content:
Opening day festivities have begun throughout the league. Fans of the Manchester Comets were eager to watch Luca MacLeish square off against Brad Vinter of the visiting Glasgow Leopards. In the end, the Comets won the game, 4-1, with Luca MacLeish earning player of the game honors. Gabriel Attrill recorded his 1st save for Manchester.

MacLeish, the winner, is now 1-0 after putting the clamps on the Glasgow offense. In 8 innings of work, he gave up 1 earned run on 7 hits, while collecting 11 Ks.

"We did a lot of things right," said MacLeish.

fields.title: Harps Raise Rally Flag, Beat Liverpool, 6-4
fields.content:
The 2018 season began for the Liverpool Dockers with a loss to the Dublin Harps at Mersey Field. The final score was 6-4. Dublin second baseman Dermott Singleton earned top player honors. The winner was Dublin reliever Fernando Martínez, now 1-0. The loser was Reece Wellings.

Bum-kyoo Kang helped his team jump on top from the get-go. His first time up in the top of the first, he cranked a run-scoring triple to give Dublin a 1-0 lead.

"It was our day today," Kang told the Dublin Chronicle. "But we've got to keep our nose to the grindstone."

fields.title: Bulls Best Kings in Pitching Duel
fields.content:
Fans of the Bristol Bulls who packed the stands for the home opener were rewarded with a Bristol win over the visiting London Kings, 2-0. Freddie Wray started for the home team against Clyde Dooley. Freddie Wray earned the coveted player of the game honors. Wray got the win, improving to 1-0. He allowed 7 hits and walked 2 over 6.2 innings. Wray allowed no earned runs. Riley Challand picked up the save for Bristol, his 1st of the year.

The Bulls got a big at-bat from right fielder Keith Mountford. For the game, Mountford was 1 for 3 with a home run and a walk. He drove in 2 runs and scored once. In the bottom of the sixth, with a runner on 1st, he stroked a 2-run home run. His 1st home run of the season gave Bristol a 2-0 lead.

"The old adage is true," said Wray. "Good pitching stops good hitting."

fields.title: Rhinos Bang Out 8-6 Win Versus Cardiff
fields.content:
The Birmingham Rhinos ushered in the 2018 season with a win versus the Cardiff Dragons at Edgbaston Field. The final score was 8-6. First Baseman Elton Jones, who is the 2017 Player of the Year winner, was named player of the game. Bartolo Méndez, credited with the win, is now 1-0. He allowed 6 runs on 10 hits in 7.1 innings.

The Rhinos got a big at-bat from third baseman Bartley Kilvington. For the game, Kilvington was 1-4 with a double, while adding 2 RBI and scoring once. In the bottom of the fourth, with runners on 1st and 2nd, he stroked a 2-run double. His 1st double of the season gave Birmingham a 4-2 lead.

"We put it together today and came out with the win," Kilvington said in postgame remarks. "That's the main thing."

fields.title: Eddison has 3 hit night, Comets Move to 2-0
fields.content:
Getting a good performance from catcher Nicholas Eddison, the Manchester Comets defeated the Glasgow Leopards, 14-8. Eddison was 3-4 with a home run, a double, and a walk. He scored 3 times and drove in 2 for the Comets. Sam Morrison was the winner. Over 6.1 innings, he allowed 2 runs on 3 hits, with 5 walks and 4 strikeouts. Manchester, at 2-0, is off to a blistering start.

Everton O'Hoban, who is rated as the 19th best prospect by BNN, chipped in for Manchester with a 2-run home run in the bottom of the first. For the game, the third baseman had 2 hits in 5 at-bats with 1 home run, 1 single, 1 run scored, and 2 RBI.

"Good to get a win," said Eddison, "but it's a long season."

fields.title: Ivers Shuts Out Dublin
fields.content:
Sweeney Ivers kept the opposition off the scoreboard and the Liverpool Dockers were all smiles after winning 7-0 against the Dublin Harps at Mersey Field today. The right-handed Ivers gave up no runs in his start, permitted 2 hits and had 5 strikeouts.

"If there was a stat for 'team shutout,' this would be it," Ivers said later. "My catcher called a great game, guys delivered at the plate and when I messed something up the guys behind me were where they needed to be."

fields.title: Kings Top Bulls Behind McGregor, 4-2
fields.content:
The London Kings topped the Bristol Bulls, 4-2, in Southern Conference action at Netham Park. The player of the game was London pitcher Cameron McGregor. With the win, London is 1-1.

McGregor's performance can only be described as masterful. He notched 8 strikeouts in 8.2 innings while allowing 4 hits. McGregor, who is rated as the 31st best prospect by BNN, goes to 1-0 on the year with 8 strikeouts.

"It takes a lot of things to win a ballgame," said London manager Kieran Kinsella. "It's usually not just one thing."

fields.title: Dragons Lose, 7-4, at Edgbaston Field
fields.content:
Cardiff first baseman Dean O'Merry had a good game in a losing cause. His team fell, 7-4, to Birmingham at Edgbaston Field. O'Merry went 3 for 4 with 2 home runs. Birmingham starter Peter Maxwell was credited with the win after throwing 86 pitches over 6 innings. His record now stands at 1-0. The Rhinos, now 2-0, have hit the ground running this season.

The Rhinos got a big at-bat from designated hitter Harry Stobart. For the game, Stobart went 1-4 with a home run. He drove in 4 runs and scored once. In the bottom of the third, with the bases loaded, he stroked a grand slam home run. His 1st home run of the season gave Birmingham a 5-1 lead.

"We'll grab a cold one tonight and go after another win tomorrow," Stobart said.

fields.title: Comets Clip Leopards, 4-3
fields.content:
Manchester played host to Glasgow at the friendly confines of The Meadow.

The Manchester Comets did just enough to sneak past the Glasgow Leopards, 4-3, at The Meadow. Manchester pitcher Damien O'Tougher earned player of the game honors. The Comets, now 3-0, have been on a roll in the early going.

Kane Hignell was a key contributor to the win for the Comets. In the bottom of the first with two out, the light-hitting center fielder stroked a single to right-center. He was 1-4, while adding 2 RBI.

"We'll put this win in our pocket and go after the next one," said O'Tougher.

fields.title: Dockers Prevail, 2-1, Over Dublin
fields.content:
Fans who came to Mersey Field watched the Liverpool Dockers and the Dublin Harps fight to the finish.

The Liverpool Dockers downed the Dublin Harps, 2-1, at Mersey Field. The Dockers were led by Dwaine Moyne, who captured player of the game honors. He was 3-3 with a double and 2 singles. Ben Tidcombe picked up the save for Liverpool, his 1st of the year.

Luca Addems, who is a three-time All-Star, chipped in for Liverpool with a solo home run in the bottom of the seventh. For the game, the shortstop had 2 hits in 4 at-bats with 1 home run, 1 single, 1 run scored, and 1 RBI.

"Runs were at a premium," said Liverpool manager Owen Wilson.

Liverpool, now 2-1, has gotten their season off to a good start.

fields.title: Bulls Rally For Late Win Over Kings
fields.content:
Bristol and London put this game in the books despite some rain.

Bristol Bulls starter Howell Embree was in a groove as he led his team to a win over the London Kings, 5-4. Bristol reliever Manobu Okazaki got the win, raising his record to 1-0. Julian Murcott was tagged with the loss.

The game was at a stalemate until right fielder Alfonso Olivares came to bat in the bottom of the eighth. Facing London pitcher Julian Murcott, he hit a first pitch changeup for a run-scoring single. It was a game-changer, putting Bristol on top, 4-3.

"One win at a time, one game at a time. We try not to get too far ahead of ourselves," Olivares told the Bristol Chronicle.

At 2-1, the Bulls have played well so far.

fields.title: Toussaint Blisters Birmingham
fields.content:
Getting 5 hits in a game has always been memorable feat in baseball. In Cardiff's 13-11 win over Birmingham tonight, which due to rain did not finish until 1:19 am, center fielder François Toussaint was red-hot, scorching them for hit after hit at Edgbaston Field. 

"To hit the ball consistently well, you have to relax," Toussaint said afterward. "I was relaxed for the first four hits, but I have to admit, I got a little tight when I realized I had a chance for five. On the last at-bat, I was ready to swing at anything close."

François Toussaint singled in the 1st, singled in the 3rd, grounded out in the 3rd, singled in the 6th, hit an RBI single in the 7th, singled in the 9th and walked in the 11th.

fields.title: Dockers Lose to Comets in Walk Off
fields.content:
The Liverpool Dockers got a superb performance from pitcher Nicky Beedell, but the Manchester Comets still won the game, 3-2. Beedell was named the player of the game despite the loss. He threw 6 innings of 4-hit ball. Ashley Comelay, credited with the win, is now 1-0. He allowed no runs on no hits in 3 innings. With their winning streak at 4, the Comets have raced to a strong start this season.

The Comets beat the Dockers with some clutch hitting. The single by Lynagh Shakerley in the bottom of the 15th is a good example. With two down, Shakerley gave his team the lead, 3-2, when he came through with the big hit.

"There are no moral victories," said losing manager Owen Wilson.

fields.title: Budge hits 2nd home run as Leopards Squeeze Past Dublin
fields.content:
Though the conditions were not ideal, the Glasgow Leopards and Dublin Harps came back from a rain delay to finish their game.

Glasgow designated hitter Andrew Budge had a 4-RBI performance, which helped his team grab a 7-6 win over the Dublin Harps. The Leopards, with only their 1st win in 4 games, have not had much to write home about in 2018.

Had Ewan Bassett not delivered a key base hit in the bottom of the eighth, the outcome might have been different. Instead, with two down and a runner on 2nd, Bassett hit a run-scoring double. That made the score 7-6, in favor of the Leopards.

"Nice to see our side come away with the win," Bassett said after the game.

fields.title: Jones goes 3-for-4, Rhinos Move to 3-1
fields.content:
The Birmingham Rhinos trumped the Bristol Bulls, 13-5, at Netham Park. Birmingham first baseman Elton Jones was named player of the game for his performance. He went 3 for 4 with a home run, a double, and 2 walks. He scored 3 runs and drove in 2. The Rhinos, now 3-1, have been on a roll in the early going.

Jones had a key at-bat for Birmingham early in the game. With a runner on 2nd, he hit a 2-run home run. It was his 3rd home run of the season and gave Birmingham an early 2-0 lead.

"We'll put this win in our pocket and go after the next one," said Jones.

fields.title: Dragons Solve Kings, 6-2
fields.content:
Cardiff right-hander Bernard Stobert made an effective start against the London Kings at Primrose Hill Park, leading his team to a 6-2 win. Stobert got the win, improving to 1-1. He allowed 5 hits and walked 1 over 8.2 innings. Stobert allowed 2 earned runs. The win gives the Dragons a record of 2-2.

A crucial at-bat came with runners on 1st and 2nd and no one out in the top of the third inning. That's when center fielder François Toussaint, who is rated as the 47th best prospect by BNN, reached on an error by the 3B. The Dragons went on to win.

Stobert told a Cardiff Daily reporter that he was "more than satisfied" with the win.

fields.title: Multi-HR Game for Waymark in 4-2 Win
fields.content:
The Dublin Harps knocked off the Glasgow Leopards, 4-2, at Cowlairs Park. Donagh Waymark, who captured player of the game honors, was a big reason Dublin won. The first baseman belted 2 home runs. He drove in 4 runs and scored twice. Lyndon Achurch picked up the save for Dublin, his 2nd of the year. Dublin, now 2-3, is off to a slow start.

Waymark had a game-changing single in the top of the seventh. On a full count fastball from Jesús González, he banged a 2-run single to left, giving the Harps a 4-2 lead. It was the 5th hit of the year for Waymark.

"I just try to see the ball and put a good swing on it," said Waymark.

fields.title: Dragons Turn Back London, 6-4
fields.content:
The Cardiff Dragons topped the London Kings, 6-4, in Southern Conference action at Primrose Hill Park. The player of the game was Cardiff designated hitter Day Hawksley. Kian Turnbull was the winner. Over 8 innings, he allowed 4 runs on 9 hits, with 2 walks and 5 strikeouts. The save went to Everton Southworth, his 1st this season.

The Dragons beat the Kings with some clutch hitting. The double by José López in the top of the sixth is a good example. With two down, López gave his team the lead, 6-4, when he came through with the big hit.

"We'll enjoy this win," said López. "But there's more we hope to accomplish."

Cardiff, now 3-2, has gotten their season off to a good start.

fields.title: Rhinos Win at Bristol, 12-5
fields.content:
Carol Peeters had a hand in Birmingham defeating Bristol by the score of 12-5 in the first half of today's double-header.

Peeters went 3 for 4 at the plate, scoring 2 times and driving in 2 runs. Peter Maxwell was the winner. Over 6.2 innings, he allowed 3 runs on 3 hits, with 4 walks and 4 strikeouts. At 4-1, the Rhinos have played well so far.

Deegan Ashman, who is rated as the 36th best prospect by BNN, aided the Birmingham cause with a 2-run single in the top of the second. For the game, the second baseman went 1-5. He drove in 2 runs and scored once.

"We can always improve and get better, but we're feeling confident after that win," said Ashman.

fields.title: Dockers Win at Manchester, 4-1
fields.content:
Liverpool Dockers starter Sweeney Ivers pitched a strong game against the Manchester Comets at The Meadow, leading the Dockers to a 4-1 win. Losses have been few and far between for the Comets so far this season. Their record drops to 4-1.

In the top of the eighth inning, catcher Freddie McKeterick came through big-time for the Dockers. With Liverpool leading 2-1, he belted a 2-run home run.

"I like our moxie," said Dockers manager Owen Wilson.

fields.title: Harps Get Road Win, 8-4
fields.content:
The Dublin Harps topped the Glasgow Leopards, 8-4, in Northern Conference action at Cowlairs Park. The player of the game was Dublin right fielder Mo Lewry. Howard Straw got credit for the win, improving to 1-0. He allowed 3 runs on 7 hits in 8 innings. The win gives Dublin a record of 3-3.

The Harps got a big at-bat from first baseman Donagh Waymark. For the game, Waymark was 3-5 with 2 doubles. He scored 3 times. In the top of the first, with runners on 1st and 3rd, he stroked a run-scoring double. His 4th double of the season gave Dublin a 1-0 lead.

"Baseball is about momentum," said Waymark, "and we feel we've got it in our favor after that win."

fields.title: Rhinos Slip Past Bristol, 6-5
fields.content:
Deegan Ashman was instrumental in his team's 6-5 triumph over the Bristol Bulls, which gave the Rhinos a sweep of the day's double header.

The second baseman went 2 for 4 with a home run. He drove in 2 runs and scored once for the Birmingham Rhinos. Ross MacAsgill picked up the win in relief, improving his record to 1-0. Riley Challand was tagged with the loss. Birmingham, at 5-1, has sizzled in the early going.

Carol Peeters, who is a three-time All-Star, helped out the Birmingham cause in the top of the eighth inning with a run-scoring double. For the game, the center fielder went 2 for 4 with a double.

"One win at a time, one game at a time. We try not to get too far ahead of ourselves," Peeters told the Birmingham Daily News.

fields.title: Kings Win, Hope to Turn Around Slow Start
fields.content:
It was a fun time at Primrose Hill Park, where the Cardiff Dragons and London Kings tangled.

Kings designated hitter Richard Minto put his stamp on his team's 5-1 win over the Cardiff Dragons. Minto was 3-4 with a home run and a double, while scoring 2 times and driving in 2 for London in the contest. London starter Kyle Lawley was credited with the win after throwing 93 pitches over 5 innings. His record now stands at 1-0.

Minto had a key at-bat for London early in the game. With a runner on 1st, he hit a 2-run home run. It was his 2nd home run of the season and gave London an early 2-0 lead.

"I really like what we did out there today," Minto said after the game.

The Kings, with just their 2nd win so far in 2018, have yet to catch fire.

fields.title: MacLeish Receives Updated Diagnosis
fields.content:
A blow for Luca MacLeish today -- team doctors were able to determine the full extent of his recent injury.

He will miss 6 weeks with acute elbow soreness. MacLeish suffered the injury on 05/04/2018. The team will likely place MacLeish on the disabled list today.

fields.title: Bristol Announces Whit Will Retire
fields.content:
Daryl Whit said he's made enough money in professional baseball, so it's time to move on.

"I did pretty well for myself, my bank account isn't hurting, maybe I'll become a manager or a team owner or something so I can make even more," he said, announcing this season would be his last. "I'm 36 years old, so I've still got some time to make something of the rest of my life."

Lifetime Whit has put up a 14-and-4 record with 3 saves and a 4.25 ERA.

fields.title: Clubhouse Prank May Sideline Rugman
fields.content:
Bristol shortstop Thie Rugman may miss a week's worth of games due to a clubhouse prank gone wrong.

According to teammates, Pablo Cedeño decided to try and give Rugman a fright by donning a mask and sneaking up on him in the shower. The prank worked. Unfortunately for the Bulls, it worked a little too well.

Rugman apparently was so startled by the intrusion that he instinctively flung his arm around to defend himself and unintentionally hit his hand against the shower knob. Rugman sustained a laceration to his hand, which required several stitches, as well as a bruised thumb.

"Thie was surprisingly good-natured about the incident," said manager Carl Gillespie. "Nonetheless, he'll be out for the next few games and that's gonna hurts us." Gillespie declined to say whether Cedeño would be disciplined for the prank, but says he does believe he is sincerely remorseful for what happened.

"I know Pablo feels worse about it than anyone, but I'll have to decide whether or not that's sufficient punishment. Either way, we'll handle the matter privately."

fields.title: NC Presents Batter of Month Trophy to Ohayashi
fields.content:
It's perhaps an award he'll win many more times through his career, as at age 23 Nobuatsu Ohayashi has a lot of baseball ahead of him.

But for now the young Manchester Comets star can enjoy the numbers he put up in May, which have garnered him the nod as the Northern Conference Batter of the Month.

His breakout month featured a .423 average with 3 home runs, 8 RBIs and 7 runs scored.

fields.title: Southern Conference Picks May's Best Batter
fields.content:
Nobody was better with the bat in May than Elton Jones, who caught everyone's attention with some hot hitting and today came away with the Batter of the Month award.

Birmingham's first baseman put together a solid month with a .368 batting average, 3 home runs, 5 RBIs and 9 runs scored.

fields.title: NC Selects Batkin May's #1 Pitcher
fields.content:
Conn Batkin hasn't been around the big leagues long enough to know that youngsters shouldn't be winning Northern Conference Pitcher of the Month. But when you put up numbers like his, you're going to get some notice.

In May the Dublin starter earned a 3-0 mark in 4 starts. He threw 24.2 innings, struck out 16 and compiled a solid 2.55 ERA.

fields.title: SC Premier Pitcher is Birmingham's Maxwell
fields.content:
Peter Maxwell's been around the league long enough to appreciate the honor he received today. After going 3-0 in May, the 33-year-old Birmingham hurler has been named Southern Conference Pitcher of the Month.

He fanned 17 in 23.1 innings, logged an ERA of 1.93 and allowed opponents to hit .179 against him.

fields.title: BIBL News: Draft Pool Revealed
fields.content:
British and Irish Baseball League divulged the 2018 list of eligible draftees today. It got little play in BNN coverage and why should it? Most players drafted in thirty days won't be on a big league club for years, if at all.

Some will languish listlessly at the minor league level. Others will suffer a series of misfortunes, never quite making their mark, but always wowing scouts with their potential. And yet, some lucky team will draw a needle out of a haystack, send him off to the minors and forget about him for a while, only to realize they've got a Hall of Famer on their hands.

At any rate, teams now have thirty days to scout the draft pool prior to the draft. The Transactions page also gets a new section dedicated to the pool.

The top players available (in no particular order) seem to be:

1. Todd Panton, 19 year-old CF out of high-school.
2. David MacRae, 19 year-old RF out of college.
3. Bradley Buckeridge, 18 year-old RHP out of high-school.
4. Roy Boatwright, 20 year-old CF out of college.
5. Ciaran Burdon, 20 year-old RF out of college.
6. Charles Farrell, 21 year-old CF out of college.
7. Douglas Hardman, 22 year-old RHP out of college.
8. Ulick McQuhirrie, 18 year-old RHP out of high-school.
9. Micah Fulcher, 20 year-old CF out of college.
10. Dwayne Shapland, 21 year-old 1B out of college.

fields.title: Kinsella Angry at Local Media Over London Coverage
fields.content:
London skipper Kieran Kinsella blasted the media today over what he considered to be negative coverage of his slumping team.

"You guys are really something, you know that?" Kinsella shouted at reporters. "All you want to do is place blame. Why can't you focus on what we're doing that's positive? Some of our guys are putting up great numbers this season, but you never talk about that. It's just a matter of getting everyone together on the same page. But you guys making your snide remarks isn't gonna help us with that, is it?"

Kinsella then abruptly stepped away from the bank of microphones and stormed angrily out of the room.

fields.title: Bristol, Manchester Confirm Trade
fields.content:
The Bristol Bulls swapped 27-year-old 3B Ashley Carruthers and 21-year-old 3B Oscar Marchant for 34-year-old RHP Sam Morrison of the Comets after what Manchester officials would only characterize as "difficult" negotiations. 

This year Carruthers is hitting at a .333 pace with no home runs and 2 RBIs. He has played in 8 games and scored 2 times.

This season Morrison has compiled a 2-3 record with a 5.23 ERA.

fields.title: Cardiff Deals O'Merry to London for Shorland
fields.content:
The Dragons and Kings confirmed this afternoon that a trade had been agreed upon. In the deal, Cardiff will get 27-year-old RF Declan Shorland, while London will receive 27-year-old 1B Dean O'Merry.

O'Merry is hitting .298 for the season with 3 home runs, 13 RBIs and 15 runs scored. He has 25 hits in 84 at-bats and played in 22 games.

This season Shorland has banged out 9 hits in 20 at-bats for a .450 average with no home runs. He is getting on base at a .500 pace and his totals also include 3 RBIs and 4 runs scored.

fields.title: Bristol-Cardiff Brawl, Mountford and Turnbull Suspended
fields.content:
The two main figures in yesterday's brawl at Netham Park have been suspended for 2 games each. That action was taken today by the league commissioner's office and will take effect immediately. The suspended players are Keith Mountford of the Bristol Bulls and Kian Turnbull of the Cardiff Dragons.

In 26 games this season Mountford has compiled a .262 batting average with 27 hits and 6 home runs. He has also scored 12 times and knocked in 15 runs.

On the season Turnbull has 2 wins and 5 losses and a 6.99 ERA.

fields.title: Rehab Road Tough For Leopards Jay MacLaren
fields.content:
Glasgow center fielder Jay MacLaren has suffered a setback in his recovery from an oblique strain. According to Leopards officials, he will be out of action for 6 days.

"Doctors are concerned with the rate of healing and have decided that MacLaren will need additional time in rehab before he will be cleared to play," one team spokesman explained to reporters.

In his stats this season, MacLaren has posted a batting average of .221 with 19 hits in 86 at-bats, 1 home run and 6 RBIs. He has also scored 10 runs, walked 9 times and compiled a .299 OBP.

fields.title: June's #1 NC Batter Announced
fields.content:
Mo Lewry, the Dublin Harps right fielder, certainly made his name known to Northern Conference hurlers over the last month. He consistently introduced himself with hit after hit and came away with June's Northern Conference Batter of the Month award.

He slashed and bashed his way to a .282 batting average while tallying up 5 home runs, 15 RBIs and 7 runs scored. He also worked NC pitchers for 9 walks and a .408 on-base percentage.

fields.title: Birmingham's Jones Collects June Batting Honor
fields.content:
Birmingham fans certainly took notice of Elton Jones's performance in June.

The 26-year-old first baseman had .326 batting average, with 4 home runs, 11 RBIs, 8 runs scored and a .473 on-base percentage.

It all culminated in him being named the Southern Conference Batter of the Month.

fields.title: NC Picks June's Top Pitcher
fields.content:
Jorge Rodríguez had an outstanding June -- so good that the Northern Conference presented him with the Pitcher of the Month Award earlier today.

"There's no way to know where the Harps would be without Rodríguez," one fan is quoted as saying.

In June Rodríguez dominated the competition, running up a 3-0 record, a 1.13 ERA and 32 strikeouts in 32 innings.

fields.title: Birmingham Starter Named SC's Premier Pitcher
fields.content:
Peter Maxwell's been around the league long enough to appreciate the honor he received today. After going 3-0 in June, the 33-year-old Birmingham hurler has been named Southern Conference Pitcher of the Month.

He fanned 16 in 27.2 innings, logged an ERA of 1.95 and allowed opponents to hit .220 against him.

fields.title: BIBL News: First-Year Player Draft
fields.content:
Rookie draft day is here! A day of excitement and anticipation in the baseball world. A big day for British and Irish Baseball League teams and all the aspiring amateur players eligible to be drafted.

The first five choices will be made by Cardiff, Manchester, Glasgow, Liverpool and Dublin.

It has been reported on BNN that the first ten selections are likely to include:

1. Douglas Hardman
22 year-old RHP out of college.

2. David MacRae
19 year-old RF out of college.

3. Charles Farrell
21 year-old CF out of college.

4. Dwayne Shapland
21 year-old 1B out of college.

5. John MacAlonie
18 year-old LHP out of high-school.

6. Finlay MacMillan
22 year-old RHP out of college.

7. Micah Fulcher
20 year-old CF out of college.

8. Todd Panton
19 year-old CF out of high-school.

9. Danny Wadsley
21 year-old SS out of college.

10. Ulick McQuhirrie
18 year-old RHP out of high-school.

fields.title: Renwick Taken First in Amateur Draft
fields.content:
In the 2018 Amateur Draft, the Cardiff Dragons took 18-year old right fielder Sammy Renwick with the overall first pick.

Many observers expected pitcher Douglas Hardman to go first, but he was passed over by both the Dragons and the Manchester Comets, who took pitcher Kieran Pringle. Hardman was eventually drafted third, by the Glasgow Leopards.

The first round in full went as follows:

Pick 1 - Cardiff Dragons:
RF Sammy Renwick

Pick 2 - Manchester Comets:
SP Keiran Pringle

Pick 3 - Glasgow Leopards:
SP Douglas Hardman

Pick 4 - Liverpool Dockers:
SP John MacAlonie

Pick 5 - Dublin Harps:
SP Finlay MacMillan

Pick 6 - Bristol Bulls:
SP Ulick McQuhirrie

Pick 7 - Dublin Harps:
CF Charles Farrell

Pick 8 - Dublin Harps:
SP Bradley Buckeridge

fields.title: Dockers Turn Back Glasgow, 4-3
fields.content:
The Liverpool Dockers stopped the Glasgow Leopards, 4-3, at Mersey Field. The Dockers got a big game from Douggie Fairless, who went 3-3 with 3 singles. The Dockers, now 4-2, have been playing some good baseball.

Had José Peña not delivered a key base hit in the bottom of the seventh, the outcome might have been different. Instead, with two down and runners on 1st and 2nd, Peña hit a 2-run double. That made the score 4-3, in favor of the Dockers.

"We try to keep the mood light around here," said Fairless. "Winning helps."

fields.title: Comets Pull Off Thrilling Win in Extras
fields.content:
Carlos Vega was instrumental in his team's 8-6 triumph over the Dublin Harps. The second baseman was 3 for 6 with 3 singles. He drove in 3 runs for the Manchester Comets. Dana Trottier got credit for the win, improving to 1-0. He allowed no runs on 1 hit in 1 innings. The Comets raised their record to 5-1.

Vega had a game-changing single in the top of the tenth. On a 2-1 fastball from Kai Easterbrook, he banged a 2-run single to right, giving the Comets a 8-6 lead. It was the 9th hit of the year for Vega.

Vega called the triumph "a good team win."

fields.title: Kings Score Late, Top Rhinos, 2-1
fields.content:
Birmingham pitcher Bartolo Méndez gave the Kings all they could handle, but in the end, London left Edgbaston Field with a 2-1 win. Méndez allowed 2 earned runs on 4 hits over 9 innings. Sumiteru Sanu got credit for the save for London. It was his 3rd of the year. Losses have been few and far between for the Rhinos so far this season. Their record drops to 5-2.

The Kings got a big at-bat from first baseman Bryan Roberts. For the game, Roberts went 1-3 with a home run. In the top of the eighth, with the bases empty, he stroked a solo home run. His 1st home run of the season gave London a 1-0 lead.

"I like the grit of this ballclub," Roberts said.

fields.title: Bulls Drop Dragons with Late Score
fields.content:
The Bristol Bulls picked up a win at Llandaff Fields, knocking off the Cardiff Dragons, 7-3. Starting pitcher Freddie Wray played a key role in the triumph. In 7 innings, Wray surrendered 8 hits, while striking out 2 and walking 1. He allowed 3 runs. Fraser Kirbishly was credited with the save for Bristol, his 1st of the season.

Nessun Tooley made it 4-3 in favor of Bristol when he delivered a run-scoring single. It came with one out in the top of the eighth. The Bulls went on to win.

Tooley told a Bristol Chronicle reporter that he was "more than satisfied" with the win. 

With the loss, Cardiff sinks to 3-4.

fields.title: Leopards Win at Liverpool, 5-2
fields.content:
Glasgow beat Liverpool on the strength of starter David Hogarth's fine effort. The left-hander led his team to a 5-2 win. Glasgow, now 2-6, is off to a slow start.

The Leopards got a big at-bat from second baseman Scott McAndrew. For the game, McAndrew was 1 for 4. In the top of the fourth, with runners on 1st and 3rd, he stroked a run-scoring single. His 1st hit of the season gave Glasgow a 2-1 lead.

"I just try to see the ball and put a good swing on it," said McAndrew.

fields.title: Harps Solve Comets, 5-2
fields.content:
Dublin right-hander Jorge Rodríguez pitched his team to victory over the Manchester Comets at Tolka Baseball Field. The final score was 5-2. Losses have been rare for the Comets, who are now 5-2. 

In the bottom of the second inning, third baseman Bum-kyoo Kang came through big-time for the Harps. With Dublin leading 1-0, he belted a 3-run home run.

Kang told the Dublin Chronicle: "Win or lose, I don't want to see our team outhustled."

fields.title: 7-2 Win by Rhinos Continues Hot Start
fields.content:
Conditions were not ideal but Birmingham and London were able to put their game in the books.

The Birmingham Rhinos got a good effort from starter Peter Maxwell in defeating the London Kings at Edgbaston Field. The final score was 7-2. Bartley Barnett was credited with the save for Birmingham, his 1st of the season.

Carol Peeters, who is a three-time All-Star, aided the Birmingham cause with a 3-run home run in the bottom of the eighth. For the game, the center fielder was 1-4 with a home run. He drove in 4 runs and scored once.

"I felt we were ready to go," said Birmingham manager Matt Sharland. "Our pregame was pretty good."

Birmingham, at 6-2, is off to a blistering start.

fields.title: Bulls Lose, 8-2, at Llandaff Fields
fields.content:
The Cardiff Dragons topped the Bristol Bulls, 8-2, in Southern Conference action at Llandaff Fields. The player of the game was Cardiff pitcher Kian Turnbull. With the win, Cardiff boosts its record to 4-4.

José López hit a 2-run double off Logan Common in the bottom of the second, which put the Dragons in front, 3-1. In addition to the double, López had 1 single and 1 walk, while going 2 for 3.

"We'll enjoy this win," said López. "But there's more we hope to accomplish."

fields.title: Dockers Edge Past Leopards, 4-3
fields.content:
Extra innings were needed to determine a winner at Mersey Field.

The Liverpool Dockers did just enough to secure a 4-3 victory over the Glasgow Leopards at Mersey Field. Nobody did more than pitcher Elton Haigh, who captured player of the game honors. Liverpool, now 5-3, has played well in the early going.

Gael Thackery, who is a six-time All-Star, chipped in for Liverpool with a solo home run in the bottom of the tenth. For the game, the designated hitter had 2 hits in 4 at-bats with 1 home run, 1 single, 1 run scored, and 1 run batted in.

"If you ever get this game figured out," said Glasgow manager Freddy MacKenzie, "let me know."

fields.title: Comets Get One-Run Win at Dublin
fields.content:
The Manchester Comets grabbed a 4-3 win over the Dublin Harps at Tolka Baseball Field. Manchester catcher Nobuatsu Ohayashi went 2-3 with a home run and a walk, while scoring 2 runs to earn player of the game honors. The Comets, now 6-2, have been on a roll in the early going.

Christopher Abercromby was a key contributor to the win for the Comets. In the top of the seventh with two out, the light-hitting shortstop stroked a single to right. He went 1-4.

"Feels good to get the job done," Abercromby said after the game.

fields.title: Rhinos Beat Kings in 11
fields.content:
The Birmingham Rhinos got a rain-soaked win over the London Kings at Edgbaston Field.

The Birmingham Rhinos topped the London Kings, 3-2, in Southern Conference action at Edgbaston Field. The player of the game was Birmingham pitcher and Dublin, Ireland native Dan Philkin. Birmingham, now 7-2, is playing great baseball to start the year.

Though he did not get the decision, Philkin did all he could to keep his team close, twirling a shutout through 8 innings, until Birmingham eventually rallied past the Kings.

"This game tested our mettle," said Philkin.

fields.title: Bulls Bang Out 7-1 Win Versus Cardiff
fields.content:
Nessun Tooley helped his team muscle past the Cardiff Dragons, 7-1. In the game, the Bristol catcher was 2 for 3 with a home run and a walk, while adding 3 RBI and scoring once. The loss drops Cardiff to 4-5.

Tooley had a big at-bat with the bases loaded in the top of the fourth inning, when he hit a run-scoring single. The Bulls went on to win.

"Win or lose, we pick each other up in this clubhouse," Tooley told the Bristol Chronicle.

fields.title: Bulls Get Road Win, 8-2
fields.content:
Bristol shortstop Joe Phelips was instrumental in his team's 8-2 win over the Manchester Comets. Phelips, who is rated as the 2nd best prospect by BNN, went 3-4 with 3 runs scored to lead the offensive attack for the Bulls.

Freddie Wray was the winning pitcher. Over 7 innings, he allowed 2 runs on 7 hits, with 2 walks and 6 strikeouts. Losses have been few and far between for the Comets so far this season. Their record drops to 6-3.

Nick Evered, who is a three-time All-Star, aided the Bristol cause with a bases-clearing double in the top of the second. For the game, the designated hitter went 3-5 with a double and 2 singles, while adding 3 RBI.

"It was a solid team effort," said Evered after the game.

fields.title: Vinter, Leopards Get 5-0 Win
fields.content:
The Glasgow Leopards got a stellar performance from pitcher Brad Vinter, who handcuffed the Cardiff offense en route to a 5-0 win at Cowlairs Park. The Dragons fall to 4-6 and continue their uneasy start to the 2018 season.

Vinter overpowered the Dragons. The Glasgow left-hander allowed 5 hits over 8.1 innings, while recording 10 punchouts. With the win, he is 1-2 on the season. 

"We put it together today and came out with the win," Vinter said in postgame remarks. "That's the main thing."

fields.title: Rhinos Turn Back Liverpool, 4-3
fields.content:
Birmingham rode a decent outing from starter Bartolo Méndez to victory over the Liverpool Dockers at Mersey Field. The final score was 4-3. Méndez got the win, improving to 3-1. He allowed 6 hits and walked 0 over 8 innings. Méndez allowed 1 earned run. The save was credited to Alfie Ritchie, his 4th.

Elton Jones, who is considered the best prospect in baseball by BNN, chipped in for Birmingham with a 2-run home run in the top of the seventh. For the game, the first baseman had 3 hits in 5 at-bats with 1 home run, 2 singles, 1 run scored, and 2 runs batted in.

"Honestly, I'm not frustrated," said Liverpool manager Owen Wilson. "The effort was great."

The Rhinos keep rolling, raising their record to 8-2.

fields.title: Harps Shut Out Kings
fields.content:
The Dublin Harps and London Kings completed their game despite the inclement weather.

Left-hander Conn Batkin mesmerized the London Kings while leading the Dublin Harps to a 2-0 victory. The Kings drop to 3-7 and continue their inconsistent start to the 2018 season.

The Harps beat the Kings with some clutch hitting. The single by Donagh Waymark in the bottom of the third is a good example. With two down, Waymark gave his team the lead, 1-0, when he came through with the big hit.

"I liked his command," said Dublin manager Aaron MacCrimmon. "Conn was throwing strikes."

fields.title: 6-3 Win by Comets Continues Hot Start
fields.content:
The Manchester Comets picked up a win at The Meadow, knocking off the Bristol Bulls, 6-3. Starting pitcher Kyle Nance played a key role in the triumph. Nance got the win, improving to 1-1. He allowed 5 hits and walked 1 over 6.1 innings. Nance allowed 1 earned run. Manchester is off to a hot start at 7-3.

The Comets got a big at-bat from catcher Nicholas Eddison. For the game, Eddison went 2-4 with 2 singles. He drove in 2 runs. In the bottom of the first, with the bases loaded, he stroked a 2-run single. His 7th hit of the season gave Manchester a 3-1 lead.

"We'll grab a cold one tonight and go after another win tomorrow," Eddison said.

fields.title: Leopards Solve Dragons, 5-3
fields.content:
Conditions were not ideal but Glasgow and Cardiff were able to put their game in the books.

Glasgow starter David Hogarth pitched effectively against the Cardiff Dragons at Cowlairs Park. The left-hander led his team to a 5-3 win. Glasgow, now 4-7, is off to a slow start.

The Leopards beat the Dragons with some clutch hitting. The home run by Jamie O'Gunning in the bottom of the third is a good example. With two down, O'Gunning gave his team the lead, 2-1, when he came through with the big hit.

"We played a good game and came out on top," said Hogarth.

fields.title: Rhinos Pull Off Thrilling Win in Extras
fields.content:
Birmingham Rhinos starter Peter Maxwell was in fine form against the Liverpool Dockers at Mersey Field, leading his team to a 5-3 win. The winner was Alfie Ritchie in relief. His record improves to 1-1. Carl Crompton took the loss. The Rhinos, now 9-2, have been on a roll in the early going.

This game was not decided until late. With one out in the top of the 11th, Kyle Postlethwaite drew a walk, driving in 1 run. The Rhinos took the lead, 4-3.

"I really like what we did out there today," Postlethwaite said after the game.

fields.title: Kings Get Win, Hope to Turn Around Slow Start
fields.content:
Getting an impressive start from Cameron McGregor, London beat Dublin by the score of 3-1. McGregor picked up the win for London, going 8 innings. He gave up 1 run on 6 hits. He now sports a record of 2-2. The Harps fall to 5-6 and continue their wobbly start to the 2018 season.

Carlton Jones was a key contributor to the win for the Kings. In the top of the fifth with one out, the light-hitting catcher stroked a single to left. He went 1 for 3. He drove in 2 runs.

Afterward, Kings manager Kieran Kinsella was ebullient. "That was a fun game to coach," he told a group of reporters, adding, "I hope it was just as fun to watch."

fields.title: 7-3 Win by Comets Continues Hot Start
fields.content:
The Manchester Comets downed the Bristol Bulls, 7-3, at The Meadow. Nobuatsu Ohayashi led the way, going 2-for-3 for Manchester. Damien O'Tougher got the win, improving to 2-0. He held the Bulls to 2 earned runs on 6 hits over 5 innings, while striking out 2 and walking 3. Gabriel Attrill sewed up the save, his 6th.

Ohayashi had a big at-bat with runners on 2nd and 3rd in the bottom of the second inning, when he hit a 2-run double. The Comets went on to win.

"It's nice to come out on top today," said Ohayashi.

Manchester goes to 8-3 with the win.

fields.title: Dragons Stymie Glasgow, Take 7-1 Win
fields.content:
Behind a solid performance from center fielder François Toussaint, the Cardiff Dragons defeated the Glasgow Leopards, 7-1. Toussaint was 2-4 with a home run, a double, and was hit by a pitch, while adding 4 RBI and scoring once for the Dragons.

Raúl Santos was the winning pitcher. Over 5 innings, he allowed 1 run on 3 hits, with 4 walks and 5 strikeouts. Andre Wake closed the door for Cardiff, picking up his 2nd save of the year.

With Cardiff leading 1-0 in the top of the second, Toussaint hit a cutter from Patrick Brown for a grand slam home run. It was his 1st home run of the season and put the Dragons ahead, 5-0.

"You can't get too high when things go well, or too low when things go bad. Right now, I'm just happy we got the win," Toussaint told the Cardiff Daily. 

The Leopards drop to 4-8 and continue their inconsistent start to the 2018 season.

fields.title: Rodríguez Excels in London Win
fields.content:
Jorge Rodríguez was instrumental in his team's 5-2 triumph over the Dublin Harps. The right fielder went 3-3 with a home run, a double, and a walk, while adding 3 RBI and scoring once for the London Kings. Kyle Lawley got the win, improving to 2-0. He pitched 7 innings, giving up 3 hits and 2 runs, while striking out 2 and walking 1. Sumiteru Sanu earned his 5th save in 5 tries.

The Kings got a big at-bat from left fielder Julian Shafto. For the game, Shafto was 3 for 4 with 2 triples, while scoring 2 times and driving in 2. In the top of the sixth, with runners on 1st and 2nd, he stroked a 2-run triple. His 2nd triple of the season gave London a 3-1 lead.

Shafto told a local reporter: "My job is to go out and play as hard as I can."

The Harps fall to 5-7 and continue their lackluster start in 2018.

fields.title: Leopards Lose, 9-4, at Netham Park
fields.content:
Bristol third baseman Jack Butler played a vital role in his team's 9-4 triumph over Glasgow. He went 2-4 with a home run and a walk, while scoring 2 runs and driving in 3 for Bristol. Earning his 2nd save for Bristol was Fraser Kirbishly. The second-place Bulls improved to 6-7.

The Bulls got a big at-bat from right fielder Keith Mountford. For the game, Mountford was 1-4 with a home run and a walk, while adding 3 RBI and scoring once. In the bottom of the third, with runners on 1st and 3rd, he stroked a 3-run home run. His 4th home run of the season gave Bristol a 3-0 lead.

"We'll grab a cold one tonight and go after another win tomorrow," Mountford said.

fields.title: Kings Subdue Manchester, 3-2
fields.content:
London left-hander Clyde Dooley made an effective start against the Manchester Comets at Primrose Hill Park, leading his team to a 3-2 win. In 8 innings, Dooley surrendered 8 hits, while striking out 9 and walking 1. He allowed 2 runs. London now has a 3-game win streak.

Colin Carter, who is rated as the 17th best prospect by BNN, aided the London cause with a solo home run in the bottom of the second. For the game, the shortstop was 1-3 with a home run.

"I like the grit of this ballclub," Dooley said.

fields.title: Harps Win at Birmingham, 5-2
fields.content:
The Dublin Harps topped the Birmingham Rhinos, 5-2, in Northern Conference action at Edgbaston Field. The player of the game was Dublin pitcher Conn Batkin. Dublin is third in the Northern Conference with a record of 6-7.

Birmingham had a runner on 2nd in the bottom of the eighth. With one out, Elton Jones came to bat, hoping to do some damage. Instead, he flied out. The score remained 4-2, Dublin. The Rhinos saw their comeback bid fail.

fields.title: Dominey Shines in Dragons Win
fields.content:
Cardiff played host to Liverpool at the friendly confines of Llandaff Fields.

The Cardiff Dragons downed the Liverpool Dockers, 11-7, at Llandaff Fields. The Dragons were led by Damien Dominey, who captured player of the game honors. He was 2-3 with a home run and a walk. He scored 2 times and drove in 4. Bernard Stobert was the winner. Over 7 innings, he allowed 5 runs on 10 hits, with 4 walks and 3 strikeouts.

Dominey had a game-changing home run in the bottom of the seventh. On a 1-2 fastball from Carleton Jolliffe, he banged a grand slam home run to right, giving the Dragons a 9-5 lead. It was the 2nd home run of the year for Dominey.

"We were able to get some things going offensively," said Dominey.

At 6-7, the Dragons are currently third in the Southern Conference.

fields.title: McAndrew Helps Glasgow Cruise to 13-3 Win
fields.content:
The Glasgow Leopards put together a convincing win at Netham Park, defeating the Bristol Bulls, 13-3. Scott McAndrew was one of the hitting stars. He was 2 for 4 with a home run and 2 walks. He scored 3 times and drove in 3 for Glasgow.

David Hogarth was the winning pitcher. Over 7.2 innings, he allowed 3 runs on 4 hits, with 3 walks and 4 strikeouts. Glasgow now owns a record of 5-9.

Andrew Budge, who is tied for 2nd in the NC with a .419 on-base percentage, chipped in for Glasgow with a run-scoring walk in the top of the second. For the game, the designated hitter had 2 hits in 4 at-bats with 1 home run, 1 single, 1 run scored, and 4 RBI.

"Win or lose, we pick each other up in this clubhouse," McAndrew told the Glasgow Citizen.

fields.title: McGregor Sensational for Kings
fields.content:
The London Kings picked up a win at Primrose Hill Park, knocking off the Manchester Comets, 3-0. Starting pitcher Cameron McGregor, who captured player of the game honors, was a big reason why. London now has a 4-game win streak.

McGregor dominated for London, raising his record to 3-2. Manchester hitters had few good at-bats against the right-hander, who scattered 2 hits over 8 innings while striking out 9.

"I just trusted my stuff," said McGregor.

fields.title: 4-2 Win by Rhinos Continues Hot Start
fields.content:
The Birmingham Rhinos got a good effort from starter Peter Maxwell in defeating the Dublin Harps at Edgbaston Field. The final score was 4-2. Alfie Ritchie, summoned from the bullpen, notched his 5th save. Birmingham is now 10-3, 3½ games up in the Southern Conference.

The Rhinos got a big at-bat from second baseman Deegan Ashman. For the game, Ashman was 1-3 with a double. He drove in 2 runs. In the bottom of the fourth, with the bases loaded, he stroked a 2-run double. His 3rd double of the season gave Birmingham a 3-1 lead.

"It was a solid team effort and we'll try to keep this momentum going," Ashman told reporters after the game.

fields.title: Beedell Fires Shutout in Dockers Victory
fields.content:
In an outstanding outing, Liverpool Dockers starter Nicky Beedell tamed the Cardiff Dragons with a 2-hit shutout at Llandaff Fields today. The Liverpool hurler went the distance, finishing with 6 strikeouts and 1 walk in the 8-0 win.

"He had a lot of first-pitch strikes and kept us off balance with a lot of off-speed stuff," according to Cardiff manager Jacob Hanbury. "We just didn't get too many balls squared up today."

This season Beedell has a 1-0 record with a 2.61 ERA.

fields.title: Leopards Lose to Bulls in Walk Off
fields.content:
The Bristol Bulls beat the Glasgow Leopards, 5-3, at Netham Park. The win was largely due to the efforts of third baseman Jack Butler, who captured player of the game honors. He was 4-4 with 4 singles. The Bulls, at 7-8, sit in third place in the Southern Conference.

Keith Mountford, who is tied for 6th in the SC in total bases with 29, chipped in for Bristol with a 2-run home run in the bottom of the ninth. For the game, the right fielder had 2 hits in 5 at-bats with 1 home run, 1 single, 1 run scored, and 3 RBI.

"This joint was rocking," said Mountford.

fields.title: Ohayashi has 3 hit day, Comets Move to 9-5
fields.content:
Manchester catcher Nobuatsu Ohayashi was instrumental in his team's 6-1 win over the London Kings. Ohayashi, who is rated as the 69th best prospect by BNN, went 3-4 with 1 run scored to lead the offensive attack for the Comets. The Comets have an impressive 9-5 record.

Ohayashi had a key at-bat for Manchester early in the game. With the bases loaded, he hit a grand slam home run. It was his 3rd home run of the season and gave Manchester an early 4-0 lead.

"We can always improve and get better, but we're feeling confident after that win," said Ohayashi.

fields.title: Dragons Slip Past Liverpool, 6-5
fields.content:
The Cardiff Dragons topped the Liverpool Dockers by the score of 6-5, with the biggest share of the credit going to catcher José López. López was 3-3 with 2 doubles and a walk. He drove in 3 runs and scored once for the Dragons on the day. With the win over Liverpool, the Dragons improved to 7-8.

Jayden Chantler was a key contributor to the win for the Dragons. In the bottom of the tenth with no one out, the light-hitting second baseman stroked a single to center. He went 1-4 with a walk.

"The game of baseball will test you," said Jacob Hanbury, the Cardiff skipper. "This one tested us."

fields.title: Bulls Subdue Dublin, 3-2
fields.content:
Bristol right-hander Freddie Wray helped his team edge Dublin by the score of 3-2. Wray kept the opposing lineup in check. The Bulls bumped their record to 8-8 with this latest triumph.

Bert MacBean, who is tied for 5th in the SC with a .322 batting average, aided the Bristol cause with a run-scoring single in the bottom of the sixth. For the game, the second baseman was 1 for 4.

"We take it day by day here," said MacBean, "and today was a good one for us."

fields.title: Dockers Trip Kings in Extras
fields.content:
Conditions were not ideal but Liverpool and London were able to put their game in the books.

The Liverpool Dockers picked up a win at Primrose Hill Park, knocking off the London Kings, 5-2. Starting pitcher Nicky Beedell was an essential part of his team's success. Reliever Carl Crompton picked up the win. His record improves to 1-2. William Littleworth took the loss.

Liverpool used the bat of Ross MacDougall to get the win. The right fielder hammered a solo home run in the top of the 12th inning to put the Dockers ahead, 3-2. It was his lone hit in 6 at-bats, but it did its damage.

"That's the key at this level, throwing strike one," said Beedell. "Successful pitchers do it."

Liverpool is now 7-7, while London is 7-9.

fields.title: Rhinos Walk Off with 5-4 Win
fields.content:
The Birmingham Rhinos reigned over the Glasgow Leopards in damp conditions at Edgbaston Field.

The Rhinos grabbed a win, 5-4, at Edgbaston Field, overcoming a fine effort from Glasgow pitcher Brad Vinter. Vinter went 7 innings and allowed no earned runs. The winner was Birmingham reliever Alfie Ritchie, now 2-1. The loser was Lysagh Hooper.

The Rhinos were down to their last out in the bottom of the ninth when pinch hitter Harry Stobart turned a first pitch changeup from Lysagh Hooper into a 2-run double. The walk-off double sent a roar through the crowd and gave Birmingham a thrilling 5-4 win.

"I just try to see the ball and put a good swing on it," said Stobart.

The Rhinos have an impressive 11-3 record.

fields.title: Victory Pushes Dragons Record to 8-8
fields.content:
The Manchester Comets got a superb performance from first baseman Diarmaid Prodger. Still, it wasn't enough to beat Cardiff. The Dragons won the game, 5-3. In spite of the loss, Prodger was named the player of the game. He hit 2 home runs. The Dragons bumped their record to 8-8 with this latest triumph.

Les MacPhee had a big 2-run double for the Dragons in the bottom of the second inning. With Cardiff leading 3-2 and runners on 1st and 2nd, he got a fastball from Kyle Nance and stroked the double to left. It was his 3rd double of the season, and more importantly, it put the Dragons ahead, 5-2.

"We'll try to build on that win," MacPhee told the Cardiff Daily.

fields.title: Harps Roll to 9-3 Win Over Bulls
fields.content:
The Dublin Harps picked up a win at Netham Park, knocking off the Bristol Bulls, 9-3. On the mound for Dublin was right-hander Jorge Rodríguez, who played a pivotal role in the win. Rodríguez, the winner, moves to 2-2. He threw 7 innings of 4-hit ball, while fanning 6 and giving up 1 walk. Kai Easterbrook closed it out for his 1st save.

The Harps got a big at-bat from left fielder Luis Flores. For the game, Flores went 1-3. He drove in 2 runs. In the top of the fourth, with the bases loaded, he stroked a 2-run single. His 9th hit of the season gave Dublin a 2-1 lead.

"That's the key at this level, throwing strike one," said Rodríguez. "Successful pitchers do it."

At 7-9, the Harps find themselves in third place in the Northern Conference.

fields.title: Kings Subdue Liverpool, 3-1
fields.content:
The London Kings and Liverpool Dockers completed their game despite the inclement weather.

London starter Cameron McGregor pitched effectively against the Liverpool Dockers at Primrose Hill Park. The right-hander led his team to a 3-1 win. McGregor went 6.2 innings to notch the win. He scattered 7 hits, walked 2, and struck out 7. His record improves to 4-2. Julian Murcott was called on to finish, recording his 1st save.

The game was on the line with two out in the top of the ninth inning, but Julian Murcott didn't flinch. With the bases loaded and Liverpool trailing 3-1, Murcott retired Ron Moffat to end the threat. "Nothing to it," said Murcott, with a wink.

The Kings sit in third place in the Southern Conference with a record of 8-9.

fields.title: Victory Over Leopards Takes Birmingham to 12-3
fields.content:
Birmingham and Glasgow duked it out at Edgbaston Field and the Rhinos came out victorious.

Birmingham starter Peter Maxwell pitched effectively against the Glasgow Leopards at Edgbaston Field. The right-hander led his team to a 5-2 win. Maxwell picked up the win for Birmingham, going 5 innings. He gave up 1 run on 2 hits. He now sports a record of 5-0. The save went to Alfie Ritchie, his 6th this season.

The Rhinos beat the Leopards with some clutch hitting. The home run by Elton Jones in the bottom of the first is a good example. With two down, Jones gave his team the lead, 2-0, when he came through with the big hit.

In postgame comments to the Birmingham Daily News, Jones said, "If the effort is there, the wins will come." 

Birmingham is now 12-3, 4½ games up in the Southern Conference.

fields.title: Hit Parade: Henshall Pops 5 Hits
fields.content:
No matter what the Cardiff Dragons threw at him today, Luke Henshall hit it. He easily handled Dragons pitching, going 5 for 5 and helping the Comets to a 12-6 triumph in the first half of a double header at Llandaff Fields. 

"The way I was swinging today, I think I could have closed my eyes and hit the ball," he told BNN reporters in the postgame interview.

Told of Henshall's quip, Dragons skipper Jacob Hanbury said he "would take him up on that next time."

Luke Henshall singled in the 2nd, hit an RBI single in the 3rd, singled in the 5th, singled in the 7th and singled in the 9th.

This year Henshall has hit at a .533 pace and produced 1 RBIs, no home runs and scored 1 run.

fields.title: Harps Sneak Past Bulls, 7-6
fields.content:
Harps center fielder Payton Tiller put his stamp on his team's 7-6 win over the Bristol Bulls. Tiller was 3 for 3 with 3 singles and a walk. He scored 2 times for Dublin in the contest. The Harps now have a record of 8-9.

This game was not decided until a few minutes after midnight. With one out in the top of the 13th, Kathel Rafferty hit a sacrifice fly. The Harps took the lead, 7-6.

"It's a satisfying feeling, to win like we did," said Tiller.

fields.title: Haigh Goes Distance in 8-1 Win
fields.content:
Liverpool Dockers starter Elton Haigh was definitely locked-in. He led his team to a win over the London Kings, 8-1. The Dockers bumped their record to 8-8 with this latest triumph.

Haigh, a native of Birmingham, England, was dealing all game. He kept London hitters off-balance, while giving the Dockers 9 quality innings. Haigh threw 121 pitches, allowing 6 hits and striking out 6. 

"We'll pop the top on a cold one and get back to work tomorrow," Haigh said.

fields.title: Comets Clip Dragons, 7-6
fields.content:
The Manchester Comets did just enough to sneak past the Cardiff Dragons, 7-6, to sweep the double header at Llandaff Fields. Manchester right fielder Luis Cardenas earned player of the game honors. The save was Gabriel Attrill's, his 7th. Manchester is now 11-6, 2½ games up in the Northern Conference.

Cardenas had a big at-bat with runners on 2nd and 3rd in the top of the third inning, when he hit a 2-run single. The Comets went on to win.

"It was offense that won us the game," said winning manager Marcus Utting.

fields.title: Longstaff Helps Rhinos Run Win Streak to 4
fields.content:
With left fielder Stephen Longstaff leading the charge, the Birmingham Rhinos defeated the Manchester Comets, 8-3, at The Meadow. Longstaff, who is tied for 4th in the SC with a .537 slugging percentage, went 2 for 5 with 2 home runs. He drove in 5 runs and scored twice. The first-place Rhinos have won 4 straight games.

Longstaff had a key at-bat for Birmingham early in the game. With a runner on 2nd, he hit a 2-run home run. It was his 5th home run of the season and gave Birmingham an early 2-0 lead.

"We swung the bats good throughout the lineup," said Birmingham skipper Matt Sharland.

fields.title: Leopards Bang Out 6-5 Win Versus London
fields.content:
A 3-RBI performance from Ewan Bassett, who leads the NC in triples with 3, helped the Glasgow Leopards beat the London Kings, 6-5. Brad Vinter was the winner. Over 6 innings, he allowed 4 runs on 6 hits, with 4 walks and 11 strikeouts. Lysagh Hooper earned his 2nd save in 4 tries.

Glasgow grabbed the momentum in the bottom of the fifth, when Bassett, who is tied for 8th in the NC in stolen bases with 1, hit a 2-run double. His 6th double of the season put the Leopards out in front, 6-4.

"I like the grit of this ballclub," Bassett said.

Even with the win, the Leopards have a dismal 6-12 record.

fields.title: Dockers Use Late-Game Magic to Beat Bulls
fields.content:
Fans who came to Mersey Field watched the Liverpool Dockers and the Bristol Bulls fight to the finish in the first game of their double header.

The Dockers grabbed a win, 7-6, at Mersey Field, overcoming a fine effort from Bristol pitcher Freddie Wray. Wray went 7 innings and allowed 2 earned runs. The Dockers bumped their record to 9-8 with this latest triumph.

The clutch at-bat came in the bottom of the ninth inning, when Liverpool designated hitter Gael Thackery, facing Fraser Kirbishly, had a run-scoring walk. It gave the Dockers the 7-6 win.

"I'm a bit of a clubhouse prankster," said Thackery. "But it's all business when we're on the field."

fields.title: Harps Pull Off Thrilling Win in Extras
fields.content:
The Dublin Harps turned back the Cardiff Dragons, 7-6, at Tolka Baseball Field. Mo Lewry was named player of the game for his fine performance. He hit 2 home runs. He drove in 4 runs and scored twice. Dublin has a 3-game win streak, while Cardiff has lost 3 in a row.

Dublin won the game in the bottom of the 11th inning. With no outs and Luke Baring on the mound for Cardiff, center fielder Dwayne Towes hit a dramatic solo home run, bringing Harps fans to their feet. 

"This kind of game is tough on the heart," said winning manager Aaron MacCrimmon.

fields.title: Comets Walk Off with 3-2 Win
fields.content:
In a low-scoring tilt between the Manchester Comets and the Birmingham Rhinos, Sam Morrison was the difference-maker. The Manchester right-hander earned player of the game honors in the 3-2 win. The Comets have an impressive 12-7 record.

Kane Hignell, who is tied for 3rd in the NC in hits with 24, chipped in for Manchester with a solo home run in the bottom of the ninth. For the game, the center fielder had 2 hits in 4 at-bats with 1 home run, 1 single, 1 run scored, and 2 RBI.

After the game, Manchester manager Marcus Utting applauded the team's effort. "They busted their tails out there," he said.

fields.title: McGregor Sensational for Kings
fields.content:
Fans who gathered at Cowlairs Park saw a good contest between the London Kings and Glasgow Leopards.

London beat Glasgow on the strength of starter Cameron McGregor's fine effort. The right-hander led his team to a 4-2 win. Julian Murcott was called on to finish, recording his 2nd save.

McGregor, now 5-2, scattered 3 hits over 8 innings for the Kings.

"We made a couple of mistakes," said Glasgow skipper Freddy MacKenzie, "and it cost us."

With the win, the Kings have a record of 9-11.

fields.title: Bulls Bang Out 7-3 Win Versus Liverpool
fields.content:
The Bristol Bulls defeated the Liverpool Dockers, 7-3, to share the day's double header at Mersey Field, with Bristol second baseman Bert MacBean named player of the game.

Pat Lafontaine picked up the win with 5 innings of work. He allowed 3 earned runs on 3 hits, while walking 3 and striking out 6. On the season, he is now 1-3. Cronan Cranidge locked down his 1st save.

MacBean had a big at-bat with a runner on 2nd in the top of the sixth inning, when he hit a 2-run home run. The Bulls went on to win.

"We'll relax tonight and get back after it tomorrow," MacBean said after the game.

Bristol currently is in second place in the Southern Conference at 9-11.

fields.title: Rodríguez Hurls Masterpiece
fields.content:
Goose eggs were the order of the day for the Cardiff Dragons as starter Jorge Rodríguez shut out the Cardiff Dragons 7-0 at Tolka Baseball Field. The Dublin pitcher struck out 9 and walked 2 while allowing 4 hits.

"Rodríguez was good but he wasn't flawless," Cardiff manager Jacob Hanbury said later. "We had a few opportunities to make something happen and we didn't do it. Not to take anything away from Dublin, but this is on us."

This year in 7 starts, Rodríguez has recorded 3 wins and absorbed 2 losses. He has pitched 47.2 innings, allowed 39 hits, struck out 40 and has a 3.40 ERA.

fields.title: Leopards Throttle Kings, 7-1
fields.content:
With second baseman Scott McAndrew leading the charge, the Glasgow Leopards defeated the London Kings, 7-1, at Cowlairs Park. McAndrew, who is rated as the 5th best prospect by BNN, was 2-3 with a home run. He scored 2 runs and drove in 3. Even with the win, the Leopards have a dismal 7-13 record.

McAndrew contributed a big hit, a 3-run home run, for Glasgow in the bottom of the second. With his team trailing 1-0, McAndrew took a changeup from Kyle Lawley and stroked the home run to left. His 2nd home run of the season allowed the Leopards to leap in front, 3-1.

"Win or lose, we pick each other up in this clubhouse," McAndrew told the Glasgow Citizen.

fields.title: Dockers Solve Bulls, 5-2
fields.content:
Liverpool and Bristol duked it out at Mersey Field and the Dockers came out victorious.

The Liverpool Dockers defeated the Bristol Bulls, 5-2. Earning player of the game honors was first baseman George Dampier, who was 2 for 4 with a home run, a double, and a walk. He drove in 3 runs and scored once. Ben Tidcombe earned the save for Liverpool, his 4th of the year.

Joe Denman was a key contributor to the win for the Dockers. In the bottom of the second with one out, the light-hitting right fielder stroked a double to right. He went 2-4 with 2 doubles. He drove in 2 runs.

"We take it day by day here," said Dampier, "and today was a good one for us."

The Dockers bumped their record to 10-9 with this latest triumph.

fields.title: Dragons Win at Dublin, 6-3
fields.content:
The Cardiff Dragons defeated the Dublin Harps, 6-3, in Southern Conference action at Tolka Baseball Field, with Cardiff first baseman Dean O'Merry named player of the game. Cardiff currently is in third place in the Southern Conference at 9-12.

George Tregellas hit a 2-run double off Ismael Rivera in the top of the fourth, which put the Dragons in front, 3-1. In addition to the double, Tregellas had 1 single, while going 2 for 3.

"The fans pay the tickets and help us do what we do, so we like to put on a show for them," Tregellas told the Cardiff Daily.

fields.title: Rodríguez Hurls Complete Game at Tolka Baseball Field
fields.content:
Dublin got an elite performance from starting pitcher Jorge Rodríguez in taking a 6-1 decision over the Glasgow Leopards. The Harps bumped their record to 11-10 with this latest triumph.

Rodríguez pitched a complete game for Dublin. The right-hander was charged with 1 run on 4 hits. He struck out 8 during his 102-pitch performance.

"Jorge is tough when he's hitting his spots," said Dublin manager Aaron MacCrimmon.

fields.title: Dockers Score Late, Upend Comets, 3-2
fields.content:
After the frustration of the game being suspended last night, people near Mersey Field no doubt heard the roar of the crowd as the winning run crossed the plate today.
